blog.name: cloudeddispositionblog
blog.title: Lots and lots of CR Posting I Guess

tags: some of these may be speculation of course we've known clay for like 2 minutes lol
summary: Molly and Clay character overlaps: “life ends so do what you can” philosophy    dedicated to helping people, especially people...
body:
Molly and Clay character overlaps:

  • “life ends so do what you can” philosophy 
  •  dedicated to helping people, especially people at their worst
  •  not extremely knowledgeable due to limited experiences
  •  enthralled by life and new things
  •  pretty damn queer
  •  inevitably shipped w/ Caleb Widogast
  •  tea

blog.name: formerlyknownas-delight
blog.title: Following my Fish
blog.description:
(she/her, 27) I post things that I admire, pictures or texts that make me think, cry or laugh, and all that is wondrous to me.
You may find: various fandoms all toroughly tagged, femslash, colourful stuff, intersectional feminism- and/or queer-related posts; sometimes, NSFW (if you are underage, related to me or generally uncomfy with that blacklist "the secret fandom" or click the PG 12 button above). I'll also gladly add TWs I don't use yet if you ask me to:)

blog.name: kanafinwhy
blog.title: Of changing and of shifting shape
blog.description: Scientist and fanfiction writer most days, space elf princess in my spare time. You may also know me as Beleriandings on AO3.

tags: just some musings on commonality of imagery /maybe just wires crossing in my brain
summary: [[MORE]] so I think it got overshadowed by the introduction of Clay just after, but as I’ve said I was really really struck by...
body:
so I think it got overshadowed by the introduction of Clay just after, but as I’ve said I was really really struck by Matt’s description of the graveyard in episode 28? Like, the way that the forest all around is creepy and oppressive and subject to some sort of necrotic (?) curse, whereas the graveyard is this bright little enclave within that, constantly being encroached on by decay yet holding out, somehow. But also the graveyard feels almost too bright, unsettling in a completely different way? It felt very otherworldly, especially with the description of the bright flowers, all mixed together across the graves. 

It actually reminded me of the imagery used in the movie Annihilation (disclaimer that I haven’t read the book yet and I heard it’s quite different but). it makes me wonder if Matt and/or Taliesin have seen that movie with its particular type of deeply-unsettling-yet-sometimes-disturbingly-beautiful bio horror. I’m thinking specifically the scenes with the mutated flowers growing everywhere with many different species on the same stem, or the people who gave up their lives to transform into flowers. The skeletons fixed to the wall with brightly coloured fungal blooms, the deer with skulls for faces and flowering branches for horns. Like, I don’t necessarily think that Clay and the graveyard he inhabits were directly inspired by this but it feels very much like the same kind of imagery, especially with the bright pink fungus that covers him and that he uses to heal people. (Admittedly it might just be coincidence/the fact that since I watched this film a couple of months ago I have been thinking about it basically ceaselessly)

But anyway, now my brain is stuck on this association I actually do think it would be interesting if through Clay and his character (and whatever backstory he has that he’s not told them yet, as I’m sure there’s A Lot) that they explore the same themes as Annihilation? It’s about change, and becoming a different person, and about things that there is no going back from. It’s about entropy and random natural violence, but also about people, and the different ways they respond to trauma. I think that having a character who explores these themes (especially a cleric) would be absolutely fascinating, especially given the arc that’s preceded this.

Anyway I don’t have a specific point to make here, but even if it’s not directly inspired by this movie I was very captivated by this imagery and I can’t wait to see what Taliesin and Matt have to give us storywise, and the direction they go in with Clay as a character following on from this.

summary: Hi hello heya! Just saw your fan art of vex rushing out of the bathtub to hug pike and I have to say that your pike is my...
question: Hi hello heya! Just saw your fan art of vex rushing out of the bathtub to hug pike and I have to say that your pike is my favourite pike, ever! The hair! The freckles! The DIMPLES! I mean! Thank you!
answer:
thank you so much for saying so!! pike is one of my c1 faves and ive gotten a lot of compliments on my design for her, it makes me so happy!! 💛💛💛💛 since she’s got the whole dawn/sunlight imagery going on, i really liked the idea of her having sort of a halo of hair, a wide smile and freckles, since those features read as being really sunshiney to me ⛅⛅☀☀

i was gonna do a portrait design lineup for VM like i did for the M9 but i only got around to doing kiki and a bit of pike and vex - the girls are my faves ofc haha - so here are some previously unreleased pickles for u ~

summary: Beside my desperate wish to bring molly back
body:
Beside my desperate wish to bring molly back

Since I researching about grave domain, weirdly, I kinda like death domain cleric’s principals more.

“Done is done.”

“Death is just what came to you, Not what you have to accept. Your acceptance doesn’t matter.”

“You can’t choose who’s gonna live. But I(my deity) choose who’s gonna die.”

What a realistic guys in the magic wonderland.

–

like…

G cleric: “you have to embrace the death! It’s the order of the world. It’s peaceful, eternal sleep. Feel it!”

D cleric : “Shut up and die already.” *stab* *vampiric touch*

tags: I didn't want to write tooooooo much so here is this
summary: How about 15. trembling hands?
question: How about 15. trembling hands?
answer: Blood seeped through her fingers, mingling with her tears. “C’mon, c’mon, c’mon.” Jester sent another prayer up to the Traveler as her hands trembled over the wound. “I will draw it all for you if we get through this please.” She was the cleric, damn it. She was supposed to have this handled. Why wasn’t she handling this?

reblog.comment: Blood seeped through her fingers, mingling with her tears. “C’mon, c’mon, c’mon.” Jester sent another prayer up to the Traveler as her hands trembled over the wound. “I will draw it all for you if we get through this please.” She was the cleric, damn it. She was supposed to have this handled. Why wasn’t she handling this?

trail.content_raw: Blood seeped through her fingers, mingling with her tears. “C’mon, c’mon, c’mon.” Jester sent another prayer up to the Traveler as her hands trembled over the wound. “I will draw it all for you if we get through this please.” She was the cleric, damn it. She was supposed to have this handled. Why wasn’t she handling this?

She was supposed to have this handled. Why wasn’t she handling this?

blog.name: luvr4fantanim
blog.title: Musings of little ol'me
blog.description: Be the chaos you want to see in the world -Mollymauk Tealeaf :) 24 year old from Mexico. Slowly dying Astro grad student. Full time Slytherin. ENFP. DnD. Critical Role. Fluent in Spanglish. Stress writer. Adores books, stories and dancing. May or may not be a fangirl in disguise. Keep away from her food. Curses at least once in every fucking paragraph. Ideal job: professional stargazer.

tags: look at me writing up my hope
summary: After Death - luvr4fantanim - Critical Role (Web Series) [Archive of Our Own]
title: After Death - luvr4fantanim - Critical Role (Web Series) [Archive of Our Own]
excerpt: An Archive of Our Own, a project of the Organization for Transformative Works
description:
Summary:

“Coming back from the dead is an ordeal. The target takes a −4 penalty to all attack rolls, saving throws, and ability checks. Every time the target finishes a long rest, the penalty is reduced by 1 until it disappears.” -Snippet from the description of the Raise Dead spell.

Snippets that transpire post-resurrection as Molly is recuperating from the ordeal. The Mighty Nein take turns making sure Molly rests enough before they continue on their journey.

Notes:

I decided to put this up as it’s own story. Mostly because it’s a lot of head cannons that I have in case Molly got resurrected and how I wanted the resting period to occur. (You have to let the body rest after Raise Dead at least because it would be severely weakened.)

I don’t know what will happen. And, to be fair, this might never happen, but I’d like to think that it does in some universe where everything is sunshine and rainbows and there was a temple rIGHT THERE.

This is a companion piece to my fic The Blood Hunter, which deals with a headcannon that I had about Molly having resurrection complications. But you don’t need to read that one to get this one.
